text: Malczewski (feminine Malczewska) is a Polish locational surname, which originally meant a person from Malczew or Malczewo in Poland.Dictionary of American Family Names. "Malczewski Family History", Oxford University Press, 2013. Retrieved on 18 January 2016. Variants of the name include Malczewscy, Malchevsky. The name may refer to: * Antoni Malczewski (1793–1826), Polish poet * Jacek Malczewski (1854–1929), Polish painter * Rafał Malczewski (1892-1965), Polish painter, writer and mountaineer * Jakub Malczewski (born 1974), Polish alpine skier * Alexey Sergeevich Malchevsky (1915–1985), Soviet ornithologist, dean of biology at the Leningrad State University. ==References== Category:Polish-language surnames
title: Malczewski
